Reviews.Title: “Vagabond Inn San Pedro”
Reviews.Author: sun245
Reviews.Content: Very outdated rooms with writing on the walls. Room had very bad odor! Very loud all night long and then 6 am neighbors alarm goes on and they wont turn it off. Breakfast was a joke! Stay at next door at San Pedro Inn and Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to San Pedro Cruise Terminal”
Reviews.Author: JM_in_California
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for overnight prior to a cruise. My wife and I, from San Diego, stayed in one; my cousin and his wife from Denver stayed in the other. We wanted to stay overnight in San Pedro so, if something went wrong with anybody's transportation, we had time to recover. The rooms were clean, comfortable and well-appointed. The property seems to be well kept. The lobby area was getting a fresh coat of paint while we were there. The location is almost perfect, being about four blocks off the end of Interstate 110, the Harbor Freeway. There are a dozen fast-food restaurants nearby on Gaffey but the only nearby sit-down place, in a hotel one block to the north, was "closed for remodeling." A five-minute drive to "Ports o' Call Village" will get you several nice restaurants. We didn't take the hotel up on their cruise parking offer because they quoted different total prices at different times and that made me a bit uneasy. We opted to park at the cruise terminal. (It isn't cheap at 12 dollars a day, but it's a tiny fraction of the cruise cost and was very convenient.)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for before cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: WEREALLYLOVETOTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: Yes- as some people have said this is an older hotel so a bit outdated. BUT it has the important things for me especially for before a cruise. Number 1 is clean- check! Number 2 - handy to destination. Not only is it handy there is a free shuttle Number 3- PRICE- How can you beat 67$ a night for 2 people? The big pluses here are the proximity to Rite Aid and CVS pharmacies- for every thing you forgot or couldn't bring on the plane. There is also a pretty decent 99c store for odd things. A Payless shoes is also handy. It is walking distance to the pier so good for a walk. Coffee is available all day and donuts for breakfast at the hotel but there is a McDonalds McCafe next door . Staff as everyone says is great- VERY helpful! I would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Allenhambro
Reviews.Content: A great value, very clean and the staff was the best. We left our car at the hotel for free for the week while on our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive place to stay before cruising”
Reviews.Author: Fairfieldcruiser
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice so far when coming in early to board a cruise at the nearby World Cruise Center. The rooms aren't 'top hat' but they are clean and the folks running this place are world class! They are so accomodating, nice and bend over backwards to make your stay with them as nice as possible with transportation to the cruise port in the morning. There's a liquor store, Starbucks, fresh donuts and a couple places to eat just a few blocks away. Very convenient and the price is right for a place to sleep. Oh yes, fresh donuts and coffee in the lobby every morning. Take the Super Shuttle from the airport- $17/person. Wouldn't think of staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: kathysaum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over night (December 2011) before boarding Princess cruise ship. Room was clean...no frills. I booked online and paid around $70. Many fast food restaurants within walking distance. Free coffee and rolls in the am. Free shuttle to the pier. Ask for a room in the back, as the front of the hotel is noisy with a lot of traffic. Didn't see the pool. Tip for those looking for liquor or snacks: There are several small liquor stores nearby that are very expensive. Save yourself some time and head further up the street to the Save Way. They have a huge selection, especially for wine and prices are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Jackhammers, No Water and No Respect”
Reviews.Author: Ocean-Rover-51
Reviews.Content: We spent the night of 23 Sep 11 there in order to be fresh and clean volunteers to serve on the Lane Victory, the last remaining World War II victory ship in service. I served as a deck officer and Diane served as an AB (helm). At one in the morning the jackhammers started. At 4 am, when we arose, there was no water. Front desk explained that water would return at 0700. We would be on board the ship by that time with our 690 guests for the cruise to Catalina. I gave them 60 hours to make this incident right and called them 3 times. No one did anything to reduce their rate. I paid with AMEX Platinum and reversed the charge. They had a chance. When I have a disrespectful crewman, I sign him/her off. The Vagabond Inn has been signed off my list.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, nice beds, but dirty carpets and pool”
Reviews.Author: MUC_PUC
Reviews.Content: Beds and bathroom o.k., but carpets made your feet look black after a few steps on the floor. Front desk staff friendly and heplful, e.g., when we asked for a refridgerator, because the one in the room wasn´t working. Pool was in a very bad condition when we arrived in the afternoon of Labor day. Perhaps an exception, but we never tried again, because it was really digusting the first day. Location is o.k., near many fastfood restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Safe stay & accommodating management”
Reviews.Author: ronsantacruz
Reviews.Content: This is an older but well maintained property; however, it is the manager, Shibley, who makes this hotel worth it. The one problem I encountered, besides road noise from Gaffey St., were the electrical outlets which required a power strip extension because the prongs of my cell charger would not stay plugged in. A power strip extension cord, kindly provided by mgmt., fixed the problem. I also appreciated the bathroom heater lamp and BATHROOM FAN. The flat screen TV was another plus. Initially, I was concerned because of the review which mentioned a glass breakage incident, but I emptied anything visible from the interior of my car and it was untouched. Yes, there is a criminal element in the vicinity, and low-income housing projects are a half-mile east near the port, but--take it or leave it--San Pedro is a microcosm of the incredible diversity of the Greater Los Angeles Area. For me, San Pedro's maritime monuments, authenticity, and historicity renders the risk negligible; moreover, having grown up in LA I find San Pedro to be relatively safe. In fact, I am more worried when in Hollywood or Venice than San Pedro. In any event, the hotel mitigates the security risk with an alert staff, and security cameras around the property. This affordable motel offers a AAA discount which makes it a good lodging option for San Pedro. The manager can also recommend good breakfast and dinner options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Does the Job fine”
Reviews.Author: jldevlin
Reviews.Content: We flew into LA the night before our cruise to Mexico, stayed here and was satisfied, it was nice there was a store so close plus a short taxi ride to the warf for dinner made for a great evening, This place at best is a 3 star but the owner is a 5 star person, I watched him helping others with info and rides to the ship, super nice guy

Reviews.Title: “G.M. Kazi Ahmed is Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: upstage5jro
Reviews.Content: this review is past overdue, this was actually in May of 2010, but I own a dance team from San Jose, Ca. and we rented out 3 rooms. We stayed for 2 days. Whenever we needed new towels, we got it. When we needed our room serviced/cleaned, they did it. Kazi Ahmed and his staff were AWESOME!! Free Breakfast was ok. Air conditioning was good. The Pool was the best thing there since it was summer time. We Will be back if ever we stay around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value. Room had microwave, fridge, good sized flat screen tv.”
Reviews.Author: zoe51899
Reviews.Content: The room is nothing fancy but good sized and clean.I was in front but didn't hear any street noise. King sized bed was comfy and plenty of pillows (4). Wifi and parking is included in price. Neighborhood is a bit run down, but Starbucks is walking distance along with a great pizza place. Great Value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great service hotel, nice pool good $ Value”
Reviews.Author: SnookieUsa
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Vagabond in San Pedro for 3 nights after our cruise and found it to be a very resonably priced, clean and friendly lodging. The manager Mr. Shiblee Ahmed goes out of his way to provide excellent service to the guests. Anything we needed or asked about was taken care of promptly and with a smile.He is readily available to his guests.. We would recommend this venue if you are looking for a good room at a resonable price with excellent service. Snookie USA

Reviews.Title: “Worked for Park n Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Smilentravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to our Disney Cruise. The price was great considering how much parking at the port would have been. The rooms were fine for 1 night. The front desk was very helpful and the shuttle worked well. The breakfast is just donuts but for kids it was fine. We had dinner at the San Pedro Brewery and that was outstanding. We had a room in the back so not much noise. My car was fine upon returning from the cruise. You have to take a taxi back to the motel when you return but it was less than $10. I would stay here again if I have the opportunity to cruise out of San Pedro again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a night”
Reviews.Author: kaj0
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed the night on our way to a cruise. Check in was very quick and the front desk was very efficient. I booked our stay online and had requested a roll away for the room. Surprise - it was already in the room waiting when we got there. My other request for a room in the back of the building wasn't met but we were only there for the one night so it wasn't a big issue. The hotel was very busy with fellow cruisers. The room was quite large and easily accommodated our family with the roll away. Although the place is older it was still clean and the beds were fairly comfortable. The downside was that it was on the street side so quite noisy. Location wasn't the best and because we had no vehicle we were very limited to food choices - lots of fast food places and very few actual restaurants within walking distance. They do offer continental breakfast but we gave that a miss as it was donuts, coffee, and juice. We also had to bypass the free shuttle. There was only one van taking about 10 at a time and we estimated at least an hour and a half wait by the time we got in line. Cab was pretty quick. Considering we only needed a place for a night before our cruise I found that it was still good value - other places close by were much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Old motel with a lot of street noise. No shuttle to Carnival Cruise Line.”
Reviews.Author: deborjak
Reviews.Content: This motel is old, needing repairs. Staying here the night before sailing on a Carnival cruise (advertised shuttle to cruiselines) was a big mistake. The shuttle took us to the port. After getting there, the shuttle driver (in broken English) told us "no Carnival". We were looking at the Disney ship! So an additional thirty dollars added to our trip taking a taxi to the Carnival Cruiseline. Vending machines didn't take bills and the front office had no quarters. Very little for the morning danish (a dozen donuts), juice and coffee. Street was very loud with traffic and sirens. Seriously! The only redeeming factor was the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We appreciated the good value, friendliness & convenience of this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kaypassa
Reviews.Content: We selected the Vagabond Inn on the basis of previous reviews and found the positive reports to be very true. We stayed overnight before catching a Saturday morning cruise. Kazi, the owner, makes available a free shuttle (we tipped) to take you to the docks. He also was very helpful in allowing us to use his house computer. Our room was spacious, quiet and clean. Morning coffee & doughnuts were available. The value was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, but sketchy location”
Reviews.Author: IdahoNativeBoise
Reviews.Content: This is a clean convenient hotel if going on a cruise out of San Pedro/Long Beach. The manager is great and they have a free shuttle to the pier. The location is a bit sketchy because of the surrounding neighborhood. OIf you have a car, drive down the street to point fermin.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, but an older motel”
Reviews.Author: ehogan
Reviews.Content: I have to commend the staff for excellent service - they really try to do the best they can. Free shuttle to the cruise ship was much appreciated. However, this is an older motel type establishment and the rooms are dark and furnished in an outdated 80's style. It felt a bit depressing with no outside light (for privacy the curtains have to remain closed). It might be a great improvement if they could add some sheer type curtains that allowed daylight to enter and yet maintained some privacy. The passageways are run down and while the paint is new, they need some sort of reburbishment - doesn't give a good impression upon entering. Breakfast consisted of donuts and weak coffee with something that was vaguely suggestive of juice. Perhaps some healthier alternatives like bran muffins and a better brand of juice. The price, of course was very good but could be summed up by "you get what you pay for". Next time we will pay a bit more and try something a bit more upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: madagou
Reviews.Content: I stayed in that hotel during 3 days. First I was in a room located at the 3rd level, on the road side. The room was big, comfy, a big flat screen with the cable but the problem was that the wifi didn't work. The day after, i went to the office and changed my room. The second one was less big but always comfy. Thinking that my wifi problem would be solved I was happy but no. In fact when I had to check my emails I was in the corridor cause only there I had a signal.... The continental breakfast is: donuts with coffee of tea that you take in the lobby! About 30 meters (just in front of 7 11 shop) from the hotel there's the bus n° 142, which is going to downtown Long beach and then you can catch the metro to go to downtown LA. It's very convenient but long. For the price that i've paid I expected more about the wifi and the breakfast but it was ok!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz Carlton, But well worth the money !!!”
Reviews.Author: shastaviewmotors
Reviews.Content: Clean and nice.Kazi the manager made us feel welcome.We also parked our car there when we were on our cruise. Thanks again to Kazi Ahmed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great service for your money”
Reviews.Author: AaronRoland
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it is close to the cruise ship terminals. We were treated like family. When Kazi, the manager, overheard us wanting to take the bus to long beach, he jumped in his car and took us there. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. They offer free parking while cruising, reasonable rates, and excellent service. The staff, especially Kazi and Akshay were out of this world. photos by Aaron Roland.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: karen8740
Reviews.Content: Four of us (two couples) stayed the night of October 30th before leaving on a cruise on October 31st. The hotel was conveniently located, staff friendly, helpful and most accommodating to our wheelchair guest. We left our car there, Kazi Ahmed the general manager insisted that the vehicle be parked near the front of the hotel so that he could keep an eye on it - when we returned from the ship - he even came out and asked how the trip was. A wonderful, warm relaxing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient - free transfer to pier.”
Reviews.Author: EugeneCruiser
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night before our cruise. The room was clean, updated, new carpet. You may have to call the main desk as some pre-cruisers can be a bit loud, pre cruise partying. The employees were very helpful and apologetic. Amazing to see the violators were in their 50's, good grief people. Anyway there was shampoo, soap, lotion in the room, large flatscreen TV. They provided coffee and donuts in the morning. The complimentary shuttle to the pier was quick, easy and clean. We took Prime Shuttle to the hotel flawlessly and reasonably. Lots of restaurants nearby, good neighborhood. A reasonable Japanese restaurant next door and the renowned Galley St. Diner for breakfast just 2 blocks away. Good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Kazi, the general manager, is one of the nicest individuals I have ever met.”
Reviews.Author: chazvelo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally up the street from the Pacifc Ocean. Gaffey dead-ends at a beautiful park that overlooks the Pacific Ocean. You can't beat this hotel in terms of price, location, cleanliness and service. The hotel is well maintained, and I was thoroughly impressed with the general manager, who went out of his way to make sure I had an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “clean and attentive”
Reviews.Author: Seward_Bryant
Reviews.Content: The first room we were given was what I had asked for for our stay 1 king with microwave & refrigerator. I found the room to pick up a bit of street noise so I returned to the office right away and asked for something on the back side. The person at the desk was pleasant and helpful. They were only able to give us a room with 2 Queen beds. The room was very roomy even at that and kept up well and very clean it also had the microwave & refrigerator . It was also very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BbeforeC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our Mexican Riviera cruise on board of Royal Caribbean to take advantage of the hotel's one week free parking with a night stay. Because we don't have to be on the ship till 3:30pm, we decided to have lunch and check out Long Beach harbor area. The last hotel shuttle to the ship ends at 2:00pm. Fully aware of this, I called the front desk on the way back to the hotel from Long Beach and asked the receptionist to call us a taxi to take us to the pier for the cruise. The receptionist kindly told us that they would take us to the pier so we don't have to use a cab. I was very impressed by this level of service. The room itself is very clean with a flat screen TV. A nice upgrade considering I've been to a few 4 stars hotels that haven't upgraded to flat screen yet. The hotel is located on a busy street and our room does face the main street so it was a bit noisy, but besides that, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room with great fresh donuts, guava juice,coffee and free paper”
Reviews.Author: ritaNovato
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before our cruise and slept very well in a huge king size bed. Had sushi (all you can eat in one hour) next door. In the morning the manager, Kazi Ahmed had the best donuts that I have tasted...they are made by someone who has been in business for 40 years. Fresh juice, coffee and a free ride to the ship (which we could see from our room). Upon our return, we were able to check in at 9:00 a.m. We went to Universal and Disneyland and enjoyed our stay for two more nights. I liked sunning by the cute little pool. Will stay here every time we visit southern cal...very clean and reasonable...and I worked for Hyatt Hotels for 36 years...getting free rooms all over the world...thank's to the whole staff!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service and Personal Attention”
Reviews.Author: RevJohnMCC
Reviews.Content: I made reservations at the Vagabond Inn because of their resonable price and the fact that they allowed you to leave your care with them while you were on a cruise. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and updated. But the thing I appreciated most was the friendly and helpful staff on the front desk. They were more than willing to suggest places to see, restaurants to eat at, and even where to buy a lottery ticket. I've made reservations for another cruise out of Los Angeles (San Pedro) and will be calling the Vagabond Inn shortly for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience”
Reviews.Author: furpo
Reviews.Content: The Vagabond is clean, all things work, fast internet, rooms small. Staff friendly, helpful. Close to a range of fine cheap mex/good chinese/ great fish/burger (all 1-2 blocks) as is bus 104 to Long Beach LA or 550 to West Hollywood. The 'continental breakfast' was a disappointment-a donut and good coffee. The famed Gaffey Diner is 2 blocks - a must do.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: txleong
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our vacation while taking a cruise out of San Pedro. Hotel costed us a little more than a regular hotel stay, but it included a shuttle to the port and parking for our van for the week we were gone. Have to take a taxi back to the hotel but was overall a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: janet1954
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vagabond Inn in San Pedro and loved it. The manager was very helpful with restraunts, sights and directions. We came in a day early and he gave us the internet rate even though it was a Saturday. We left our car while we cruised and it was totally safe. The rooms were comfortable and clean The bed was comfortable. If you are cruising out of L.A.. This is the hotel for you! Janet

Reviews.Title: “Great for night before cruise from LA”
Reviews.Author: elaineedington
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay before a cruise out of port of LA. Stay, park your car and they take you to the terminal. Car is safe. Clean, honest. Next door to wonderful sushi,noodle restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “a little concerned, but ended well”
Reviews.Author: sabear69
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel little later in the evening. I was a little concerned about the area and leaving my truck there for a week while we were on a cruise(they have cameras every where) . The next morning getting on the ship missplaced my camera ,after looking everywhere with no luck. We got back to the hotel ,my truck was perfectly fine and they kept my camera in the office for me cause I left it in the shuttle van. Again Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, VERY clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: MagicSkye
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff were very pleasant, knowledgeable and accomodating. Our room was spotless! So comforting to stay in a hotel that is CLEAN! Fresh donuts, coffee and juice in the morning and a free shuttle to the cruise terminal by a very capable and professional driver. The Japanese restaurant right next door is excellent and comes highly recommended. We would definately recommend this property and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: kruizerkarol
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night pre-cruise, not impressed. There are no amenities. No iron, no hair dryer, no coffee pot, fridge is locked. Only one elevator which got crowded. Room was very musty smelling. Water did not drain in the tub so you took a shower in a puddle. Lucky to be in the back so no road noise, relatives had the front and it was noisey all night. Breakfast is a stale donut if they don't run out. Only one shuttle to the cruise ship and lots of people wanting to take it. Had to pay $10 for a taxi back to hotel when we returned. Won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for cruise!”
Reviews.Author: TinaGrodt
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be clean, safe, friendly for the budget conscious traveler. If you are going on a 7 day cruise, and are driving to San Pedro, you can leave your car in the parking lot for seven days, and save some money. The hotel will transport you to the pier in a van for free. There will be some city noise - come on, it's LA! - but not enough to bother us. Beds are very comfortable. Do not confuse this hotel with the Vagabond Inn in Longbeach! If you plan to park your car, you must book with the hotel, not a web site. WARNING!!!! The free parking is only good for 7 days, or you will pay an additional $50! At that price, you can do better at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “luxury feel at dicount price”
Reviews.Author: l0vet0m0ve
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel exceeds in all ways. The rooms are average size, but the linen and bed were one of the most comfortable I have been on. The staff are amazingly helpful and courteous. There is WiFi and a TV with all possible channels. There is even a superb japanese restraunt on the corner that has some rediculously fresh fish sushi!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for park and cruise from Port San Pedro”
Reviews.Author: paayawma
Reviews.Content: Great value for park and cruise from Port San Pedro, Free shuttle to the “Cruise Center”. Modest. Clean. Helpful management. Restaurants within walking distance. I was very impressed with this motel and have told many of my friends about it. I plan on returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a great experiance.”
Reviews.Author: Caribbean_D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night before our cruise on the Princess Sapphire, over Valentines weekend. We have traveled all over the worl and I have to say that this Inn and the stay & cruise package was the best deal in southern California. The sushi bar in the parking lot was a huge bonus, and then front door srvice to the cruise ship was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there if you are not a smoker”
Reviews.Author: ennovy2010
Reviews.Content: It was supposed to be a non-smoking room. The smell of cigarette smoke was so bad that all my luggage and clothes smelled badly for days. I asked to change my room but they said they didn't have another room to change and didn't even make an attempt to freshen up the room. The area did not seem very safe either. Their continental breakfast was a donut and less than desirable drinks. The Japanese resturant next door was expensive and the service was poor. The only good thing about the hotel is the close proximity to the cruise ship centre and the shuttle service to the there. I would not stay again or recomend anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “2 wrongs = 1 right”
Reviews.Author: MoonThistle
Reviews.Content: Due to a non working telephone and a water pipe break in the street the general manager took great care of us & because of this ~ I would happily stay at this hotel over and over.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Excellent Service, Extremely Clean, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: MoPapermaker
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience with this hotel. The Staff was very pleasant, they recommended the best Italian Restaurant nearby, the room was very pleasant and clean, we were taking a cruise and the location of the hotel was close to the port, the free shuttle to the port was convenient and the driver was very attentative to our needs. They even had 24 hour coffee and free continental breakfast. Price was very reasonable, I don't think anything could have been much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For The Money”
Reviews.Author: luvcruzin50
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy access to the cruise ship port and offered free shuttle service. The room was clean, neat and had an unexpected nice towel and lotion/shampoo arrangment. On the downside, our room was facing the front street (Gaffey St.) and unfortunately had a lot of street noise. Recommend to ask for a room toward the back. Lobby personnel was very helpful and there were several restaurants and stores within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very close and convienient to San Pedro Harbor for those who like to cruise”
Reviews.Author: Poohbearkona
Reviews.Content: About a 5 minute ride from the San Pedro Harbor......excellent hotel location for those who cruise.......FREE bus ride to port........FREE parking for those who need to leave their cars for a week .......Vagabond hotel will take care of your car at no expense.......Highly recommended!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Inn With A Gem Of A Manager”
Reviews.Author: Wicker27
Reviews.Content: We travelled with friends to the Vagabond where we could park the car while we went on a Princess Cruise to Mexico with a modest fee. Kazi Ahmed, the Manager, welcomed us and provided us with our pre-requested non-smoking, ground floor room - my wife is handicapped needing easy access to the facilities. He was most efficient and showed a good sense of humor. Later we had a little problem with the toilet flush handle and he had a repairman there in minutes to fix it. On request, he recommended to us a sea-food restaurant which turned out to be great experience. The next morning, I could not locate my pass-port and without it we were dead in the water for accessing the cruise. Kazi was so good at assisting us in advising on what to do under the circumstances and made his facilities available to help. Above all, he said he needed me to relax and think out my situation. After about 60 mins of termoil, it occured to me that I had hid my pass-port in my money belt and my crisis was over. In the mean time, he outlined the unthinkable if the pass-port could not be located, i.e. how we would spent the time in San Pedro while our friends went of the trip without us. It included a room special. Next, we were immediately transported to the ship using the Inn's van, and on our return seven days later, we were welcomed by Kazi while we picked up the car. The icing on the cake would have been if the Inn picked us up on the ship return at the wharf. The Inn was clean & comfortable and near restaurants of various categories, just ideal for our purposes. We will gladly book a return visit to this very cost effective haven with friendly and accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Night before cruise”
Reviews.Author: casinocim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in December before our cruise. We took a shuttle from LAX and arrived at the hotel at 11am, hoping we could check into a room early. The rooms were not ready yet but the clerk said my son could swim in the swimming pool. We could store our bags in back of the lobby. We also asked about a restaurant to go to, he gave us a name and sent us up the road. We had my stepdad with us and he just can't walk very far. We came to a Hawaiian bbq place and stopped there. It was a fast food place but the food was good. Came back to the hotel and my son tried to swim. the water was very cold and dirty, lots of things floating in the pool. So he changed and we sat around the pool area which is nice until a room was ready. I only have one pic of the hotel and it is of part of the pool. There are tables and chairs out there and some landscaping, ashtrays. They gave us a room on the bottom floor right next to the pool. The room is just a room, it was clean but did have a smoke odor. It wasn't horrible to us, so we stayed there. The beds were pretty hard. Did not hear noise from the street. In the morning we had our comp breakfast, it was just donuts and coffee, there might have been some juice. This was fine for us since we were getting ready to embark on 14 days of eating on the cruise. I had read another review about getting the shuttle to the cruise terminal, to be out there before 10:45am, this is correct. I tried telling my mom that but she wanted to wait. The line grew longer. The shuttle is a van. Instead of waiting for the shuttle we called a cab. I would stay here again, just a place to sleep before a cruise, nothing fancy. There is a Japanese restaurant sitting on the corner of the hotel lot. About a block away was the Hawaiian bbq, and a pizza place. In the other direction is a McDonald's, half a block and I would say about two blocks is a Rite aid for last minute purchases and a Starbucks across the street from there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Night Before A Cruise”
Reviews.Author: BOBNYVONNE
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here and recommended it to all of our friends looking for a place to stay before a cruise for quite a few years. We enjoy the fast food close by and pizza delivery. Starbucks within walking distance, drug stores and a Tai restaurant next door. Very convenient. The shuttle to the cruise dock is a great plus. The staff is so very helpful. My friend "lost" her gold necklace during her overnight stay and asked about it on returning 10 days later from her cruise. The staff had found it in her room and had it for her !!! Such honesty. The rates are reasonable. The manager always welcomes us and sees to it that we get to the cruise dock on time. You just can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible , helpful staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: caseyaz
Reviews.Content: Kudos to Kazi ! He saved the day and helped me retieve my handbag - with cash, credit cards and passport- which I had forgotten in a cab. He was reassuring and calm while I was frantic. He immediately called the cab company when I informed him what happened and helped me through the ordeal. My handbag was returned to me and I am so grateful for his incredible kindness and helpfulness. THANK YOU KAZI!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stop before a cuise”
Reviews.Author: Schnyder
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights before we left on our cruise. Great place to leave your vehicle while you are away. Nice to have the shuttle to the port too. Rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful helpful and courteous people.”
Reviews.Author: geewhiz88
Reviews.Content: this vagabond inn is a great place to stay. the staff are all friendly and helpful especially general manager kazi ahmed. if going on a cruise they will transport you to the local port. i would definitely stay there again when in the area. ed and judith---las vegas

Reviews.Title: “Park and Cruise Package”
Reviews.Author: dag144
Reviews.Content: We were attracted to this hotel because the Port of San Pedro website mentioned that the Vagabond Inn had a part and sail package. We were taking a seven night cruise from the port. I called the hotel directly rather than use the Vagabond website. I learned from prior experience that special "deals" are best confirmed directly with the local hotel. We were quoted a great rate and took the room. Although we had booked about six weeks in advance the desk clerk remembered that I had telephoned. This is a good indication of the level of service. Everything was ready. The clerk told me where to park in the event that we could not find an obvious space that evening. Since we ate at a Japanese restaurant adjacent to the Inn, parking was not a problem The room was clean and comfortable. The beds were excellent and the TV included lots of free HBO channels. The Inn is about a five minute drive from the cruise terminal. The shuttle was perfect. I understand that it runs from 9:30 to 11:00 each morning. We went down at 10:45 and were at the pier before 11:00. Since the shuttle is not available for returning guests, we took a cab -- cost $6.75. The Inn is in a dull location and the only nice restaurant within walking distance is the Japanese place (really very good) unless you want fast food. There was only one chair in the bedroom, so I made good with one of the nice double beds. Excellent value for someone who is driving to the San Pedro cruise terminal and needs a place to sleep the evening before.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean but not fancy”
Reviews.Author: ellenTucson
Reviews.Content: We spent the night before taking the ferry to Catalina Island. The room was clean but a bit worn. Staff was very friendly. We were able to leave our car there for the weekend. I think the cost was $25 for the weekend, which was less than parking at the marina.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: MrStraightTalker
Reviews.Content: I am recently back from a month of solo-travelling in California. As I was using public transport, location was an essential factor when choosing accommodation. Having caught the blue Metro line south from Downtown Los Angeles, it takes around an hour to reach Long Beach Transit Centre. There's then a bus at Stand A that takes you to San Pedro and almost drops you off outside the hotel. In hindsight, Long Beach and San Pedro were not areas that I should have spent as many as three nights in. However, this should not distract from the quality of accomodation that I found at the Vagabond Inn. Reception staff were very friendly and rooms comfortable with plasma televisions. Refreshments were available 24/7, as well as a swimming pool during main hours. San Pedro sea front is a fairly lengthy walk away, albeit on the same bus route as mentioned before. There are lots of local takeaways, but no bars unless you head Downtown. The local library staff were extremely helpful and signed me up for free internet use, which allowed me to plan my trip further ahead. Overall, I enjoyed staying at the Vagabond Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: mmimnagh
Reviews.Content: Have just returned to Ireland from 3 week trip around California. Stayed in many nice hotels along the way and in terms of service and comfort the Vagabond Inn in San Pedro was high on the list. The manager Kazi and the staff at the front desk couldn't do enough for us and Kazi even dropped us at the cinema one evening to save us the taxi fare-very kind of him!! Rooms were clean and comfortable with daily housekeeping and plasma TV's. Breakfast donuts were nicest I've ever tasted and location is accessible to LA and several lovely beaches. Pool was clean and nice place to relax as it wasn't overly crowded. Would like to thank Kazi and all the staff at the Vagabond for helping to make our time in LA enjoyable!! Shaun and Michelle xx

Reviews.Title: “A great stop over hotel before our cruise”
Reviews.Author: Kamloops17
Reviews.Content: We came from Las Vegas, and took a shuttle to the hotel. $40 for the Prime time shuttle. The room was large and clean and the staff very friendly. There were quite a few restaurants to eat close by so that was great. We did not get up early enough for the breakfast provided so went up the street to a Mexican place and got some breakfast burritos. A quick shuttle ride was provided to the Princess cruise ship terminal. For any one who complains about having to pay for a taxi back to this hotel from an arrival cruise, you should stop and think, ... the hotel is a great value for your stay, so pay for a taxi back and finish your holiday knowing your car was at a safe place, or you are now staying at a value price, but clean hotel. Maybe not the fanciest, but I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: cmscrapperjen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 different time last year and just as before, the manager and staff were very accommodating. The premises are kept clean. They provide free shuttle to the Cruise Terminal.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: princesscruisers
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Vagabond Inn in San Pedro the staff and general manager , Kazi Ahmend, made our stay smooth and comfortable. Given the central location in San Pedro on Gaffey street the location offers a wide range of choices of places to explore and to dine in. Just minutes from the Cruise terminal and easy access from LAX. The location gave us direct bus service to both downtown L.A. and Longbeach. The transit from LAX to the hotel cost us total only $3.00!!! Transit to the ship was provided by the Inn. The Inn was priced well and offered all we required. We have already made plans to return.

Reviews.Title: “The park and sail program was very convenient for us.”
Reviews.Author: billied
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms. Friendly staff and gave helpful imformation regarding restaurants and other area information. It worked out well and made us more rested to start our cruise the next day. The transportation and parking was great too!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good night before sailing off on a cruise”
Reviews.Author: men48
Reviews.Content: This was a very good hotel for a nights rest before beginning a cruise and perhaps just a good place to stay for any other reason. The location was excellent and their were plenty of restaurants nearby. The rrom was very comfortable. The only complain was of other guests who arrived late and carried on a loud conversation just outside our door. The shuttle service could be improved. I eventually walked to the dock because the wait was just too long for the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great for cruisers!”
Reviews.Author: nielsh22
Reviews.Content: We were going on a Princess Cruise to Mexico and The Vagabond was the perfect place to stay. Its close to the marina and they had a shuttle that took us straight to the boat. The rooms were small but clean. Perfect for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Like their slogan says "Great Value Friendly People"!”
Reviews.Author: suzzeq11
Reviews.Content: We just returned from LA (Sand Pedro) on a cruise. We originally had reservations for the Holiday Inn - but their website price balooned to over $95.00 per night! So we did a bit of research and found - right next door - the Vagabond Inn! Internet saver rate is VERY affordable - and boy were we pleasantly surprised. This inn far exceeded our expectations! Room was CLEAN - quite large - looked as though it had just been painted. Nice outdoor pool - good continental brekkie (thanks for the yummy fresh donuts and really tasty coffee) - very nice staff. We were very impressed - they also have a park and sail program - free shuttle to the cruise ship terminal - an overall great experience - we would not hesitate recommending this great place - close to almost everything - this inn is GREAT - thanks Kazi and staff - we had way more fun @ the Vagabond than we had on our cruise home! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, good accomodations”
Reviews.Author: noeclym
Reviews.Content: The Vagabond is perfectly located for a park & cruise motel. The rooms are comfortable and it is only 5 minutes by supplied shuttle to the cruise terminal. It is not the 4 Seasons, but for price and location it is just fine. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and park for a cruise!”
Reviews.Author: gfield50
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Good place to stay before your cruise. Reasonable price compared to other places I had checked.

Reviews.Title: “Economical & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JJNWesternArizona
Reviews.Content: The Vagabond Inn provides comfortable accomodations and a very economical way to park your car while your on a cruise. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel prior to cruise.”
Reviews.Author: 06tuna10
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for the night before a cruise. The hotel staff were very accomodating, even provide a van to the pier. We were able to leave our vehicle at the hotel for the 7 days of the cruise for less than half of what it cost at the pier. The hotel is an easy walk to/from the pier. The rooms were clean and quiet, but a bit worn.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: wldlnd
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and it provided a clean atmosphere with easy access to the cruise ship departure and was reasonably priced

Reviews.Title: “Best deal around!”
Reviews.Author: kaliforniagypsy
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms! Kind staff! Convenient location! We stayed a night here using their Cruise and Park service. Good rates, and they even have a shuttle to catch the Ship. We were told we'd have to get a taxi back once we returned from the cruise, but that was no problem. WELL worth it!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: marie1234567
Reviews.Content: Clean and decent rooms and staff friendly and very helpful

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, while cruising.”
Reviews.Author: pvh9
Reviews.Content: convenient, clean and wonderful staff. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Drop off but no pick up at ship”
Reviews.Author: Netfeather
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me since I could leave my car in their lot while taking a cruise out of LA. The cost was less than another hotel stay plus parking at the pier but it was hardly worth it. The room was clean but dark and not at all attractive. I could not get help bringing my bags to the room. When I got to the room my key card didn't work and because I was alone I had to drag all my bags back down to the lobby with me to get another key. The room faced the street and was pretty noisy. Next day I took their shuttle to the cruise pier which went pretty smoothly. They did help me get my bags in and out of their van. When the cruise returned I called for a pick up and only then did they inform me that they don't pick up. I had to take a cab back to the hotel which pissed off the cab driver because he had been waiting in line for an hour and a half and all he got was a short fare to San Pedro. Since I didn't want to be dumped in front of the hotel with my heavy bags I told him if he took me right to my car and put the bags in the trunk for me I would make it worth his while so the 5-minute taxi ride ended up costing me $20.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice people!”
Reviews.Author: thefreeman
Reviews.Content: Very accomidating. They allowed us to get in our room extremely early because we had drove thru the night. Nice place to leave your car when going on a cruise. Thanks for the clean room and good coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Much more than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Driver91
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel for one night before a Princess cruise to Hawaii. The temperature turned out to be great for the time of year, and I got to see a fair bit of the area in a rental car. The hotel is located at the end of I-5, very close to the cruise terminal, and extremely close to many food outlets and other services. This makes it easy to get a lot done even on foot. The hotel staff were very helpful when asking about what was nearby, etc. as well as during checkin and checkout. One staff member went out of his way to let me know the airport shuttle had arrived. The free WiFi had an odd SSID name, and the hotel staff didn't seem to know much about it, but it worked fine nonetheless. The room itself was clean, well-stocked, and in very good condition. The satellite TV was a nice touch as well. Overall, the location, the friendly staff, the great room, and a reasonable price made my stay very enjoyable. I'd highly recommend this hotel not just for a one-day stopover but even for longer stays in the San Pedro area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, affordable”
Reviews.Author: MomOF3Oregon
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before our cruise on Norwegian Cruise LInes. Very affordable (we called the hotel and they matched the lowest price we found through an online search) and clean. We requested a room on the backside of the hotel so as to avoid the noise of the street in front. You can ask for hair dryers and irons at the desk. No fridge, microwave or coffee in rooms. Coffee down front with donuts in the morning. Coffee was pretty good. Daniel (desk guy) gave good directions to a tasty inexpensive Chinese quick food restaurant within a few blocks. Helpful, courteous service; free shuttle to cruise port every 15 minutes in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Park and Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Perlr
Reviews.Content: Very convenient when taking a cruise out of San Pedro CA. Stay the night and then leave your car for the time you are away - very affordable and staff were friendly. If you are looking to Park and Sail then this is a good option. The Burden Family from Vancouver Island, BC

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the PARK & SAIL overnight package”
Reviews.Author: Calex-Albany
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vagabond Inn for the PARK & SAIL package ($119) which includes one night of lodging and 7 nights parking while cruising out of San Pedro. Parking at the cruise terminal is $12 per night. This was a very good value. The PARK & SAIL package is now priced at $149 which is still attractive. Although, the Vagabond Inn appears to have been last updated in the 80's, it was clean and smelled decent. The front desk staff was very attentive to our needs, particularly Daniel Burke. The coffee pot in the lobby always had fresh coffee available. The next time I cruise out of San Pedro, I would definitely use the Vagabond Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel for cruising to Mexico !!!!”
Reviews.Author: chattykathyxx
Reviews.Content: We drove from Oregon and this motel in San Pedro.....was clean, neat, priced well, and perfect for a park and cruise vacation for us !! The shuttle was timely in the morning and we were able to leave our car there for the entire week, rather than having to pay for parking at the cruiseline. Taxi on our return to the motel was also easy and we would highly recommend this motel if going cruising.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel if you are going on a cruise!”
Reviews.Author: love_traveling_53
Reviews.Content: Thirteen of my family were going on a cruise. We drove, so this hotel was perfect, as you can leave your car for free in their parking lot during your entire cruise and they have free transportation to the port. To get back, you only need a $7 taxi ride to the hotel. The hotel was clean. The staff was friendly. We will stay here again when we go on our next cruise.

Reviews.Title: “First Cruise as Man and Wife”
Reviews.Author: loversaqui
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms and staff were great. We were only there for one night but it was very memorable. The shuttle to our port was easily accessible and got us there in an expeditious manner. The only thing I would change is to have a way to be picked up after the cruise other than that all was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: DHMaine
Reviews.Content: Used the stay and park while on cruise. Room had view of ship, CLEAN, newly decorated, Roberto was helpful, prompt delivery to ship in CLEAN van. Short ride to cruise pier. Great value for the money. Cab fare back from pier less than $8.00.

Reviews.Title: “Honesty Still Abounds”
Reviews.Author: MsChu
Reviews.Content: We had a cruise planned and this is the perfect stop for one night before getting on the ship. The rooms are not very fancy, but are very clean and it did contain a flat screen TV. I had thought I had lost forever a very valuable and one of a kind diamond and ruby ring. I informed the desk upon leaving for the ship, heartbroken, that I had lost my ring and could not find it. Upon our return after the cruise, after a week, imagine my surprise when the manager told me they had found my ring. I was and still am elated to know that honest people still exist and can be found at the Vagabond Inn in San Pedro, CA. Clarine Merritt

Reviews.Title: “Above And Beyond”
Reviews.Author: lodibob
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed overnight at this hotel in San Pedro so we could leave our vehicle in their parking lot for the week while we cruised to Mexico. Everything about this hotel was excellent, but the reason I am writing this review was to thank Kazi Ahmed, the General Mananger, as while cruising on the ship I realized that I had lost my truck keys and were no where to be found. Kazi went out of his way to let me use all resources he had available to get a set of keys made and get on my way asap. He let me use his phone, computer, fax, and copy machine. Hats off to this gentleman and I would highly recommend this hotel to everybody. Thanks again Kazi

Reviews.Title: “Vagabond Inn is the place to stay ,”
Reviews.Author: occam76
Reviews.Content: Just a thanks to Roberto and the staff of the Vagabond Inn in San Pedro CA. Besides running a top flite operation . Roberto and his crew really do thier best to make my stay comfortable when I visit . Recently I had a mix-up regarding the dates of my stay. I had pick the wrong date and allowed me to chnge dates without penality. Im extremely grateful for thier flexiblilty for his handling of the matter . Good place to stay at a good price and very helpful staff .

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Scuzzy, and worn ragged.”
Reviews.Author: bfrazier
Reviews.Content: Most people end up here looking for a place to park and stay prior to a cruise, and location wise that's understandable. I think we can all do better than this one though. For your money you'll get a tattered, somewhat dirty, smelly and loud room above a busy road full of noisy traffic. In the morning you'll have the most meager and perfunctory of continental breakfasts - juice coffee and donuts - no fresh fruit, toast, etc. It's a rough neighborhood too. While you're away, your car will be left out in an open unguarded parking lot. You will get a shuttle ride to the cruise dock though, and while the driver may say "Look for me when you return!" the truth is it's a one way trip - you'll have to pay your own way back via a cab. It's a shame that the choices right now seem to be very nice but way high end waterfront places like the DoubleTree or dumpster dives like this. I hope the mainstream hotels or the cruise industry itself will seize the opportunity to build an intermediate solution, at least in San Pedro where it seems to be maximum gouge for the dollar no matter which way you turn. Good luck, be safe, have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Park and cruise”
Reviews.Author: Pissfir1
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay before a cruise out of San Pedro, CA. They will store your vehicle for the duration of the cruise. Also they have a shuttle to take you to the ships. You do need a taxi to get back to the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “overnight ok”
Reviews.Author: 2isablessing
Reviews.Content: our family of 4 including twin 6 year olds needed a place to stay that was inexpensive for the night before our cruise. Upside: Clean towels, convenient location, free parking for 1 week during our cruise, great deal for $136.92, walking distance to restaurant for breakfast/starbucks and shuttle service for a cost to cruise port, quiet room. downside: stinky smoke smell even though room nonsmoking, and cheap hotel/motel look and feel.

Reviews.Title: “Honest”
Reviews.Author: cfe262
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vagabond Inn in San Pedro one night just prior to our cruise. We found the hotel clean and the staff was very friendly and honest. In a rush to meet up with our shuttle, my 24 year old daughter left her cell phone in her room and did not realize it until the ship departed. She called the hotel and spoke to Kumar who told her that they found it and would hold onto it for her. Upon our return, they had her phone and returned it. My daughter was very grateful. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is an older hotel but the rooms are comfortable and the staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Pre Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1947berty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before a cruise...Shuttle from airport dropped us at hotel...Room was all ready..No hassles...Old decorating but SUPER CLEAN..No smell, bathroom spotless, bedding excellent... No Noise that bothered us. Took a taxi to Port o Call for dinner and shopping and back, about $5 each way... Shuttle to the ship in the morning was ready to go when we were - around 10am...Definitely would stay there again before a cruise...Not a destination hotel but defintely a good inexpensive place to spend the night

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Clean Hotel for Budget Price...”
Reviews.Author: monakayk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before our cruise. I knew from other folk's (online) reviews that this hotel would not be the 'Ritz' but a good, clean, basic, budget hotel. I totally agree...this hotel was a VERY good value for the money. Even though the room was small (no extra chairs or small table in a double room) it was very clean. In fact...the bathroom was the cleanest I have seen and used in a hotel for a very long time...and I can compare the cleaniness to many 5 star hotels I had been in. I know that is hard to believe, but I think since this hotel is older the staff really tries very hard to keep it as clean and nice as possible. They accomplished that as far as I was concerned. The pool was nice. They advertise a continental breakfast: it consists of donuts, coffee, tea and the best Guava juice I have had since I vacationed in Hawaii. There is is liquor store right across the street, McDonalds and KFC next to it..takes less than 1 min. to get to each. They also provide a FREE shuttle to the cruise port. I will most certainly stay again at this hotel if I ever cruise out of LA again. I gave this hotel an above average rating because of the Cleaniness, Free Shuttle to Cruise Port, Friendly/Helpful Staff, Great Vaule for the money--however it is an older hotel and that should be remembered and considered by anyone before staying here. MonaK

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the night”
Reviews.Author: biting
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive place to spend the night in LA. Paid about US$70+ for a weekend night. Rooms looked old. The carpet was a bit dirty. My feet were black walking on the carpet. Towels and bedsheets were clean though. I reached the place at about 11pm, so literally I just spent the night there. Ample free parking. Hotel was secured in that you needed a key to go into the hotel compound. Hotel had air con, free wifi. Overall ok for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: BabeMaine
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights. The room was clean but very worn. The staff was very nice. Our problem with the hotel is its location on busy S. Gaffey Street. The traffic is 24/7 - we finally turned on the A/C unit to attempt to drown out the vehicle noise. I had read reviews on various web sites and knew it was on a busy street so asked for a room on the backside when we checked in. I was told the tenants in the apt. building behind the hotel sometimes played their music extremely loud so it probaby wouldn't be any better. I wish I would have tried it anyway - the music couldn't have been any worse. If you are used to a lot of road noise, this hotel would be adequate. We live at the end of a dead end road so are used to extreme quiet. Also very disappointing is a "breakfast" that consisted of donuts, coffee, and juice. It was convenient to the ferry terminal - only a 10 minute ride, perhaps less.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Cruising out of the LA Port”
Reviews.Author: LVWOLF
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews herein about the close proximity to the LA port and were able to book a 1 night stay before our cruise. The room was bare bones but "clean" i.e. bathroom and bed. There is a Sushi restaurant, a Starbucks and McDonald's a block away. 2 blocks down is a Rite Aid and a Big 5 sporting goods store if you forgot anything before your cruise. I travel a lot for work and fortunate enough to stay at 4 star hotels, nonetheless, for a 1 1/2 star rating the Vegabond exceeded my expectations. There is coffee and donuts in the a.m. We were able to park our car at the Motel for 1 week for the price of $50. This was $24 cheaper than at the port. There is a free shuttle that runs every 15 minutes from the Motel to the port that begins at 10 a.m. We took a cab back to the Motel after our cruise and it cost us $7 minus tip. The customer service at the Vegabond was good and professional. If you are not hung up on accomodations and need a clean place to stay before your cruise, I highly recommend this Motel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: synd00d
Reviews.Content: great service very friendly staff, clean rooms no doubt in my mind i will return. I was very pleased with the hotel and great shuttle to cruise port.

HotelInfo.Name: Vagabond Inn San Pedro
HotelInfo.Address: 215 South Gaffey St., Los Angeles, CA 90731
